intro: Verbascum birjandense, commonly known as the Birjand mullein, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the genus Verbascum, which is part of the family Scrophulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. The leaves are thick and woolly, adapted to reduce water loss in its native habitat.
